intro: Phyllanthus stenophyllus, commonly known as the narrow-leaf phyllanthus, is a shrub native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which is characterized by its production of latex and often milky sap. The plant typically has small, alternate leaves with a narrow, elongated shape, and it produces yellowish flowers in clusters. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in semi-arid environments. The plant's botanical features make it adaptable to various ecological conditions, contributing to its widespread distribution.
